title: Twist in Pune rape case: Woman knew accused from before, wrote 'threat note' herself
content: Pune police report a twist in the alleged rape case involving an IT professional, indicating the assailant was known to the woman. Evidence suggests the selfie used was taken and edited by her, and she typed the threatening message. Authorities are investigating the rape claim, noting inconsistencies in her initial account and her mental state.

title: ‘We cheer for West Indies except when ... ’: PM Modi’s cricket banter in Trinidad
content: Narendra Modi visited Trinidad and Tobago. He addressed the Parliament and spoke about the strong ties between India and Trinidad. He received the country's highest civilian honor. President Christine Kangaloo praised Modi's kindness. Modi also highlighted the shared love for cricket. His visit is part of a five-nation tour. He will also attend the BRICS Summit in Brazil.

title: ‘Modi ji, where are you?’: Kharge slams PM, says 'India surrounded by enemies'
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's foreign policy, alleging strained relations with neighboring countries like Nepal, alongside China and Pakistan. Speaking in Hyderabad, Kharge accused Modi of neglecting domestic issues, citing his numerous foreign visits while Manipur faces unrest. He challenged the BJP's stance on secularism and socialism, questioning their presence in the party's constitution.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: Worst in 148 years! Prasidh Krishna sets unwanted Test record
content: India initially dominated Day 3 of the second Test, dismissing key England batsmen early. However, Jamie Smith and Harry Brook launched a stunning counterattack, scoring centuries and shifting the momentum. Their aggressive batting dismantled India's bowling strategy, particularly punishing Prasidh Krishna, whose expensive spell highlighted concerns about India's pace attack.

title: Dhaba workers on Kanwar routes told to remove trousers during 'identity drive'
content: Uttar Pradesh police have issued notices to supporters of an ashram head for allegedly conducting unauthorized identity checks on dhaba workers along the Kanwar Yatra route in Muzaffarnagar. The group demanded Aadhaar cards and other personal details, even attempting to verify a worker's religion forcibly.

title: Bumrah bursts into laughter at Ravi Shastri's on-air comment
content: During the second Test at Edgbaston, Jasprit Bumrah was spotted in the Indian dugout wearing a radio earwig, drawing attention from commentator Ravi Shastri. India, after scoring 587, watched as England's Harry Brook and Jamie Smith formed a strong partnership. Mohammed Siraj's impressive 6/70 helped India bowl England out for 407, securing a significant first-innings lead.

title: Tesla CEO reiterates push to deorbit ISS: Shares post on Twitter; says ‘It’s time to retire…’
content: Elon Musk has once again advocated for the deorbiting of the International Space Station (ISS), suggesting a shift in focus towards Mars missions. Citing the ISS's diminishing utility and the high costs of extending its lifespan, Musk proposes redirecting resources to private ventures and Mars exploration.

title: Caribbean visit: PM Modi receives Trinidad and Tobago's highest civilian honour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the Order of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, the nation's highest civilian honor, during his official visit. Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar recognized PM Modi's global leadership, ties with the Indian diaspora, and Covid-19 humanitarian work. PM Modi dedicated the award to 1.4 billion Indians.

title: Trump’s 'big, beautiful bill': Why it's making China laugh - and stronger
content: A new US bill, championed by President Donald Trump, is raising concerns about its impact on America's renewable energy sector. Experts warn it favors older industries while hindering the growth of solar, wind, and electric vehicle markets. Critics, including Elon Musk, foresee a loss of competitiveness against China, which is aggressively investing in clean energy.

title: Amazon’s new milestone: Deploys one millionth robot in centers
content: Amazon has reached a milestone by deploying one million robots across its facilities and introducing "DeepFleet," a new AI model to optimize robot fleet efficiency. This move aims to reduce travel time and enhance delivery speeds. While Amazon emphasizes robots working alongside humans and creating new roles, CEO Andy Jassy acknowledges potential workforce reduction due to increased automation.

title: $425K debt/family: How Trump’s bill could gut US - Wall Street waves red flag
content: Donald Trump's new economic package faces criticism. Experts like Ray Dalio warn of potential financial disruptions. The bill increases national debt significantly. Concerns arise about rising interest rates and a weaker dollar. Some fear the US may lack resources for future crises. The package's impact on the global economy is also under scrutiny. Markets are watching closely for potential interventions.

title: Why Swami Vivekanda batted for football
content: It sounds like Swami Vivekananda Diego over dharma, but those who read that line and stop there prove precisely why he said it in the first place.It is as misunderstood as Karl Marx’s “religion is the opium of the masses,” which, as Kurt Vonnegut pointed out, for its time and place was like saying religion is like aspirin. It just gave people a little peace in troubled times.

title: Richest WWE women stars: Rhea Ripley to Becky Lynch; net worth revealed
content: WWE's female superstars have amassed considerable wealth through lucrative contracts, merchandise sales, and endorsements. Becky Lynch leads with a net worth of $7 million, followed by Charlotte Flair at $5 million. Liv Morgan's net worth is around $3 million, while Rhea Ripley's is estimated between $1 million and $3 million, boosted by various brand collaborations.

title: Connor McDavid’s mindset: What is it according to insiders' view on Oilers contract
content: An insider view into Connor McDavid’s current mindset paints a complex picture as the Edmonton Oilers superstar weighs his future. While no official contract talks have started, NHL analysis suggests that the ongoing silence could lead to mounting pressure if the Oilers fail to align with McDavid’s long-term goals.

title: Cardi B reacts sharply: Stefon Diggs’ Europe trip stirs buzz, cryptic 3-word message
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: House of gold: Indore contractor’s 24-carat gold-plated villa draws fire
content: Content creator Priyam Saraswat's video tour of a gold-laden mansion in Indore, owned by government contractor Anoop Agarwal, sparked outrage. The video, showcasing gold-coated interiors and luxury cars, led to accusations of misappropriated public funds.

title: India-US trade deal: 'We don't make deals based on deadlines,' says Piyush Goyal
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal stated that any trade agreement between India and the United States will only occur if it benefits both nations. India does not adhere to deadlines for trade agreements.

title: From Saif Ali Khan to Resham Tipnis: Top 5 entertainment news
content: The world of showbiz is buzzing with legal twists, emotional revelations, and resurfaced memories. From Saif Ali Khan’s ancestral Bhopal properties being declared 'Enemy Property' and his plea getting rejected by the High Court, to Baazigar actress Resham Tipnis expressing outrage over fake news about her son Manav's suicide — drama and disbelief are running high. Add to that Smita Jaykar’s candid recall of real-life sparks between Salman Khan and Aishwarya Rai during Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam, and you’ve got a roundup of the top 5 entertainment stories stirring conversation in tinsel town today.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi watches Edgbaston Test, reveals his role model
content: VVS Laxman orchestrated a valuable experience for India's U19 cricketers, arranging their visit to the Edgbaston Test to witness Shubman Gill's impressive innings. Coach Hrishikesh Kanitkar emphasized the importance of learning red-ball cricket techniques from Gill's masterful approach. Young players like Vaibhav Suryavanshi and Anmoljeet Singh expressed inspiration, fueling their aspirations to represent India after watching Gill's performance.

title: Bhojpuri beats and Bihar ki Beti: India’s deep cultural connection with the Caribbean
content: If blues was the magic carried by African slaves, chutney music was the sorcery of Indo-Caribbeans. It is Bhojpuri folk electrified with Caribbean swagger – dholak beats fused with soca basslines and steelpan melodies. Lyrics toggle between Hindi, English, and Creole, telling stories of Krishna’s rasleela, rum-shop heartbreak, and gossip at weddings.

title: ‘No position on matters of faith’: India reacts to Dalai Lama succession row
content: India has refrained from commenting on the selection process for the next Dalai Lama, emphasising its commitment to religious freedom. This stance follows the current Dalai Lama's declaration that his successor will be chosen by the Gaden Phodrang Trust, a statement perceived as a challenge to China's claim to appoint the next spiritual leader.

title: Scary scene! Shubman Gill takes nasty blow to the head
content: During the second Test against England, Indian captain Shubman Gill was struck on the head while fielding, causing immediate concern. Fortunately, after treatment, he resumed playing. This incident followed Gill's emotional high after receiving messages from his parents, celebrating his record-breaking double century, marking a significant milestone in his career and India's Test history in England.

title: Marathi slapgate row: Fadnavis says 'hooliganism will not be tolerated'
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has vowed zero tolerance for hooliganism in the name of Marathi pride, following recent assaults on individuals for not speaking the language. This statement comes after incidents like the Mira Road assault, where a shop owner was attacked.

title: 'Reserve right to ...': Amidst trade talks, India eyes retaliatory duties against US
content: India has proposed retaliatory tariffs against the United States at the WTO in response to American safeguard measures on the automobile sector. The US imposed a 25% tariff increase on imports of passenger vehicles, light trucks, and specific automobile parts from India.

title: Big revelation on Op Sindoor: 'China fed Pak live data on India assets, Turkey sent trained staff'
content: Lieutenant General Rahul R Singh revealed that China provided Pakistan with real-time intelligence during India's 'Operation Sindoor.' He highlighted that Pakistan may target Indian population centers in future conflicts, emphasizing the need for a robust air defense system.

title: Samruddhi Expressway crash: Nagpur businessman Radheshyam Jaiswal among 4 dead
content: A tragic accident on the Samruddhi Expressway near Washim claimed the lives of four members of the Jaiswal family from Umred. The incident occurred when their car collided with a divider, resulting in the deaths of Radheshyam Jaiswal, Madhuri Jaiswal, Vaidehi Jaiswal, and Sangeeta Jaiswal. The driver is critically injured and under treatment.

title: '6 balls, 6 actions': Ishan Kishan imitates Dhoni, Harbhajan, Warne in 1 over
content: Ishan Kishan last played a Test for India during the tour of the West Indies in July 2023. While his IPL 2025 season with Sunrisers Hyderabad was modest — 354 runs in 14 games — his recent red-ball form in England has been far more compelling. On Wednesday, in an unexpected turn, he was handed the ball and made full use of the opportunity.

title: 38 years of guilt: Kerala man, in his 50s, confesses to killing unknown man in 1986
content: In Kerala's Malappuram district, Muhammadali, 52, confessed to a killing he committed as a 14-year-old in 1986. He claims he acted in self-defense after being harassed while working on Devassya's property in Kozhikode. Burdened by guilt following recent family tragedies, Muhammadali led police to the scene.

title: Watch: Massive fireball erupts in Rome fuel depot; over 20 injured
content: A massive explosion at a Rome fuel station injured 20, including eight police officers responding to the scene. Initial reports suggest a truck crashed into a pipeline, triggering the blast and subsequent fires. The incident, marked by a large fireball and thick smoke, prompted evacuations of nearby buildings, including a children's camp.

title: Dalai Lama successor: Tibet's prez-in-exile picks apart China's 'Golden Urn' tradition
content: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA) president, Penpa Tsering, challenged China's claim over the Dalai Lama's succession, questioning Beijing's interference in Tibetan religious freedom. This response follows China's insistence on the 'Golden Urn' process, which Tsering argues is a relatively recent imposition.

title: DSP Siraj breathes fire! Sends Stokes for a duck, leaves Root fuming - WATCH
content: Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell on Day 3 of the Edgbaston Test has put India in a commanding position. He dismissed Joe Root and then Ben Stokes for a golden duck in consecutive deliveries. Root edged a flick to Pant, while Stokes was undone by a sharp bouncer. India aims to level the series after England's initial victory.

title: 'Is ECI God?': Pappu Yadav's 'do-or-die' call as Bihar roll revision row flares
content: Pappu Yadav, a Congress-leaning MP, has declared a "do-or-die battle" against the Election Commission's electoral roll revision in Bihar, labeling the ECI as an "office of the RSS." Congress has also criticized the revision as a "sinister exercise" to disenfranchise voters. Despite opposition protests, parties like RJD, Congress, and others have deployed thousands of BLAs for the revision process.

title: Vanessa Bryant steps out: Special mother-daughter night, honors Dodgers’ Clayton Kershaw
content: Vanessa Bryant, continuing the family's Dodgers fandom, attended a game with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri. The family cheered on their favorite team as Clayton Kershaw achieved his 3,000th strikeout, a significant milestone. Vanessa shared photos and videos of the special night on Instagram, highlighting the family's love for baseball and celebrating Kershaw's achievement.

title: Krishna Janmabhoomi row: Allahabad HC says Shahi Eidgah ‘not disputed’; plea dismissed
content: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea by the Shahi Jama Masjid committee, challenging a survey of the Shahi Idgah mosque in Sambhal. Hindus claim the mosque was built over a demolished temple.

title: Caught on cam: Man sets relative's house on fire over financial dispute
content: In Bengaluru's Vivek Nagar, Subramani allegedly set fire to his relative Sathish Kumar's house over a financial dispute. The incident, occurring on July 1st, caused damage to the property, though no injuries were reported. The conflict stemmed from a loan taken years ago by Parvati from Venkataramani.

title: Reshad Jones loses $2.6M: Alleged con by trusted advisor; luxury spending spree
content: Former Miami Dolphins safety Reshad Jones, known for his on-field prowess, is now a victim of a $2.6 million embezzlement scheme. Financial advisor Isaiah Williams allegedly siphoned funds for personal luxuries, with Octavia Monique Graham accused of laundering over $1 million. Graham is in custody, while Williams remains at large, leaving Jones grappling with betrayal and significant financial loss.

title: Elon Musk wants the ISS retired: Slams Trump’s $1.25 billion funding
content: Elon Musk wants the International Space Station to shut down. He suggests focusing on Mars missions instead. He thinks the ISS is old and costly. NASA plans to deorbit the ISS by 2030. Some support Musk's Mars vision. Others worry about losing ISS research and partnerships. A gradual shift is a suggested solution. The debate continues.

title: Joe Burrow trends online: Fans spot him alone, 'extremely sad' in Beverly Hills
content: A video shows Joe Burrow walking alone in Beverly Hills. This has led to fan concern. The Bengals quarterback appeared downcast. Social media is full of reactions and theories. Some fans worry about his well-being. Others speculate about the reason for his mood. There is no official statement from Burrow or the Bengals. The internet continues to discuss the video.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: Sheinbaum hopes Chávez Jr. does time in Mexico
content: President Claudia Sheinbaum said Friday she hopes boxer Julio César Chávez Jr., who was arrested Wednesday in Los Angeles for overstaying his visa, "will be deported and serve the sentence in Mexico."

title: Sources: M. Wagner rejoins Magic on 1-year deal
content: Free agent forward/center Moe Wagner has agreed to a one-year, $5 million deal to return to the Magic, sources told ESPN.

title: UEFA fines Chelsea, Barcelona over violations
content: Chelsea were fined €20 million for breaking financial monitoring rules and Barcelona were ordered to pay €15m by UEFA on Friday.

title: 'Devastated': Liverpool teammates grieve Jota
content: Diogo Jota's teammates at Liverpool including Virgil van Dijk and Jordan Henderson have been expressing their grief following the forward's death.

title: Keys stumbles, Osaka fades in Wimbledon losses
content: Madison Keys became the latest top-seeded player to suffer an early loss at Wimbledon, while Naomi Osaka once again exited in the third round.

title: Ex-Arsenal midfielder Partey charged with rape
content: Former Arsenal midfielder Thomas Partey has been charged with five counts of rape and one count of sexual assault by the Metropolitan Police Service.

title: 2 allegedly stole $2M+ from ex-Dolphins safety
content: A woman is in jail after she and a former financial adviser were accused of stealing millions of dollars from former Dolphins safety Reshad Jones.

title: Trump wants UFC fight on White House grounds
content: President Donald Trump says he is thinking of staging a UFC match on the White House grounds with upward of 20,000 spectators to celebrate 250 years of American independence.

title: Is this Djokovic's last chance to win a final Grand Slam?
content: Wimbledon is likely Novak Djokovic's greatest opportunity to win a record 25th Grand Slam. Can he do it?

title: Angel Reese, Alyssa Thomas and 10 more predicted All-Star reserves
content: Which 12 players could fill out the WNBA All-Star roster? We make some predictions -- and discuss some cuts.

title: 'Once I saw A'ja do it, I did it': How Wilson's leg sleeve inspired a new generation
content: The three-time MVP's practical solution to keeping her legs balanced has taken hold across the sports world.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: 'The great ones know how to find it': Why K.C. still expects the best from Travis Kelce
content: Chiefs coaches and teammates don't doubt Kelce's ability to step up in clutch moments again like he did in the playoffs last season.

title: Who’s the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever? No. 10? No. 262?!? We named top all-time selections at every slot
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: USMNT still hasn't had a convincing win since Mauricio Pochettino took over. Time is running out
content: Since Pochettino became USMNT coach, the team still hasn't had a signature win. The Gold Cup final vs. Mexico is the last chance before the 2026 World Cup.

title: Diego Luna, USMNT's Gold Cup hero, is ready to take on Mexico in final
content: The Mexican-American playmaker is excited for his first encounter with El Tri in Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: Jota's funeral to be held in Gondomar on July 5
content: The funeral of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota and his brother, André Silva, will take place on Saturday at 10 a.m local time in the Portuguese town of Gondomar.

title: Sources: Utd give Rashford's No. 10 shirt to Cunha
content: Manchester United have taken the No.10 shirt off Marcus Rashford and given it to new signing Matheus Cunha, sources have told ESPN.

title: Sources: Utd tell wantaway stars to delay return
content: Manchester United have told five players including Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho to delay their return to training to allow them more time to find moves away from the club, sources have told ESPN.

title: Williams shuns Barça, signs 10-year Athletic deal
content: Nico Williams has signed a new contract with Athletic Club until 2035, snubbing Barcelona's advances to sign him from the Basque side this summer.

title: Ex-Barça forward Coutinho joins Vasco de Gama
content: Aston Villa have confirmed that Philippe Coutinho has joined Brazilian side Vasco de Gama on a permanent basis.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: MLB Power Rankings: Four top-10 teams debut at highest rankings of 2025
content: While the Astros continue their ascent, the Rays and Blue Jays are threatening the Yankees in the AL East.

title: Sleepers, busts and breakouts for 2025
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea eye move for Madrid's García
content: Chelsea are willing to pay €40m to land 21-year-old Real Madrid forward Gonzalo García. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gyökeres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Defiant Verstappen guarded over Mercedes speculation
content: Max Verstappen again refused to be drawn on ongoing speculation he might leave Red Bull for Mercedes in 2026.

title: What to know ahead of the British Grand Prix at Silverstone
content: Seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton is the most successful driver at the British GP with nine wins,

title: Ranking the fights: Usyk-Dubois 2, Taylor-Serrano 3, Pacquiao's return and more
content: From Oleksandr Usyk, a women's trilogy fight and Manny Pacquiao's return, ESPN picks July's best fights.

title: Profar comes back strong? Crawford leads league in steals? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Fantasy Baseball Forecaster for Week 16: July 7-13
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead with our forecaster, which has pitcher rankings, hitter ratings and more.

title: Bihar polls can be held based on 2024 electoral rolls: D. Raja
content: CPI General Secretary D. Raja urges the Election Commission to postpone voter roll revision in Bihar to prevent exclusion

title: Wait continues for Devanahalli farmers as CM seeks 10 days to examine legal issues
content: While the next meeting is scheduled on July 15, the farmer leaders and activists have decided to continue their protest at the 13 villages where lands are proposed to be acquired

title: Allow Aadhaar and ration cards as key documents for Bihar special revision of electoral roll: INDIA bloc
content: A delegation, led by coordination committee head Tejashwi Yadav, submitted its demands to the State Chief Electoral Officer; Rashtriya Janata Dal’s national executive body that met in Patna opposed the exercise to revise the voters’ list

title: HC imposes ₹50,000 costs on Competent Officer (Evacuee Properties)
content: The judge noted that the competent officer failed to adjudicate the matter even after lapse of 25 years

title: Won’t allow ‘sinister exercise’ of poll roll revision in Bihar, says Congress
content: “The unnecessary haste, and their absolute refusal to address genuine concerns raised by Opposition, point to there being a clear effort to destroy the electoral system in Bihar,” says K.C. Venugopal

title: Manipur sets December target to shut down relief camps; resettlement begins
content: Chief Secretary P.K. Singh says Centre, State government, and CSOs (civil society organisations) are working towards the resettlement of the internally displaced people

title: Seawall construction at Chellanam to be completed in time-bound manner
content: Seawall to prevent erosion and boost beach tourism, says Minister; 7.3 km completed, funds sanctioned for remaining 3.5 km

title: Nipah restrictions in 20 wards in Malappuram, 6 in Palakkad
content: N-95 mask made mandatory for people in containment zones; residents warned against chasing away bats as stressed bats may produce more bodily fluids, potentially increasing the risk of virus transmission

title: ‘To emerge as a true global power, India must secure technological sovereignty’
content: Ajay Kumar Sood, Principal Scientific Adviser to the Government of India, delivers the convocation address of VTU

title: ‘Open the Yellow Line’: Public frustration peaks over constant deferral of metro launch
content: The much-anticipated corridor, which links R.V. Road with Bommasandra via the tech hub of Electronics City, remains unopened despite civil work being largely completed

title: 345 people on  Nipah contact list in Kerala
content: Experts caution people that roosting bats should not be disturbed by bursting crackers or by any other means. Health department directs affected districts to strengthen contact tracing by focussing around hospitals and other health-care institutions and to ensure that none are missed when preparing the contact lists

title: Staff back new disciplinary rules at Sanskrit varsity
content: Teachers urged the varsity Syndicate to hold talks with students, stressing that the curbs should not hinder academic freedom or access to facilities

title: Government counters Opposition campaign that delayed emergency response caused hospital collapse death
content: Post-mortem report indicates that Bindu had died instantaneously due to a head injury from the falling debris, says Cooperation Minister

title: She Was Angry At Friend For Forcing Sex: New Detail In Pune Techie Rape Case
content: The IT professional who claimed that she was raped at her home in Pune on Wednesday filed the complaint against her friend allegedly "out of anger", police sources said, introducing an unexpected twist in the case.

title: Exclusive - Biology Beyond Earth: How Space Station Is Shaping Human Life in Space
content: Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is visiting a home away from Earth that has seen continuous human presence for a quarter of a century and is floating around 400 kilometres above Earth.

title: Starmer Reveals How "Good Relationship" With Trump Helped Him Secure A Deal
content: Keir Starmer, the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom has said that despite "different political backgrounds" he has found common ground with the President of the United States, Donald Trump.

title: 3 Arrested Over Possession Of Hydroponic Weed Worth Rs 4 Crore In Mumbai: Cops
content: Three persons were arrested allegedly with hydroponic weed worth more than Rs 4 crore from Andheri in Mumbai, a police official said on Friday.

title: 'Pak Doesn't Know Where Masood Azhar Is, May Be In Afghanistan': Bilawal Bhutto's Stunner
content: Pakistani politician Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has, in a stunning claim, said Islamabad does not know where Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Masood Azhar is, adding that the country would be "happy to" arrest him if India gives information.

title: Stabbing Suspect In Finland Has Violent Criminal History: Police
content: Finnish police said Friday that the 23-year-old man suspected of stabbing four people near a shopping centre in Finland had a history of violent crimes.

title: At WTO, India Proposes Retaliatory Duties Against US Aver Auto Tariffs
content: India on Friday proposed imposing retaliatory duties under the WTO (World Trade Organisation) norms against the US over American tariffs imports on the country's auto parts in the name of safeguard measures.

title: Escaped Pet Lion Attacks Woman And Children On Pakistan Street
content: An escaped pet lion chased a woman and two children down a busy street in Pakistan's Lahore, police said, with dramatic footage showing the big cat leaping a wall before pouncing on them.

title: Show Cause Notice To Cops For Delay In Ekta Kapoor Probe Report
content: A Mumbai court on Friday issued a show cause notice to city police for not submitting an inquiry report in a criminal complaint filed against film and television producer Ekta Kapoor for allegedly disrespecting Indian soldiers in one of her web serie

title: Watch: Doctor Performs Surgery On 8-Foot Long Cobra In Rajasthan
content: Showing no fear of being bitten by a poisonous snake, a doctor in Rajasthan conducted life-saving surgery on a reptile with serious injuries.

title: How Enslaved Americans Responded To July 4 Declaration Of Independence
content: The summer air in Rochester, New York, hung thick with heat and celebration. It was July 5, 1852, a day after cannons had fired, flags waved and towns across America had burst into patriotic jubilation

title: Air India Pilot Collapses Before Operating Bengaluru-Delhi Flight: Report
content: An Air India pilot collapsed just before operating a flight from Bengaluru to Delhi, PTI reported, quoting sources on Friday.

title: 20-Year-Old Dies By Suicide In Madhya Pradesh, Livestreams It On Instagram: Cops
content: A 20-year-old man allegedly hanged himself to death in Sagar district of Madhya Pradesh, livestreaming the suicide on Instagram, a police official said on Friday.

title: Swiss Glaciers Hit Annual Tipping Point Weeks Early
content: The snow and ice accumulated last winter by Switzerland's glaciers has already melted away, a monitoring service said, with Friday marking the alarming second-earliest arrival on record of the tipping point known as glacier loss day.

title: Ultratech Chief Legal Officer Resigns Amid Cement Cartelisation Probe
content: Ultratech Cement Limited has announced the resignation of its Chief Legal Officer, Anoop Khatry, effective Thursday. Mr Khatry, the company said, quit because of personal reasons.

title: Setback For Saif Ali Khan, Family As Rs 15,000 Crore Property Case Goes To Retrial
content: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has set aside a two-decade-old trial court judgment and ordered a fresh hearing in the case involving one of Bhopal's most protracted royal property disputes.

title: 'India's Interest More Important, Not Deadline': Piyush Goyal On US Trade Talks
content: India is in no hurry to finalise any major trade deal on the basis of a deadline, but will agree on a decision if it is a win-win for both parties, Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said today.

title: Ultratech Under Scanner In Cement Cartelisation Case
content: Fair trade regulator CCI has directed Aditya Birla firm UltraTech, which now owns south-based cement firm India Cements to submit financial documents after its Director General in its investigations found contravention of competition norms.

title: The Fireworks Origin: Why America Lights Up The Sky On 4th Of July
content: Every year on July 4, skies across the US light up with fireworks to mark the Independence Day.The US gained independence in 1776 after the 13 colonies declared their separation from British rule by adopting the Declaration of Independence.

title: Collector kickstarts probe into  Kottayam Government Medical College Hospital building collapse
content: As part of the investigation, the Collector visits the site of the collapse to conduct a preliminary assessment

title: Wayanad landslides: HC seeks govt.’s report on utilisation of Central funds for rehabilitation
content: Utilisation of ₹120 crore Centre had allotted for rehabilitation of people affected by landslides in Wayanad in 2024

title: Urban growth must prioritise environmental sustainability: Manohar Lal
content: Union Minister calls for self-reliant, accountable municipal bodies at national conference on urban governance

title: Andhra Pradesh Fire Services D-G directs officials to identify hazardous areas in industries to prevent accidents
content: Instructions have been given to the officials of the departments concerned to keep away the high risk process areas away from other processing units and administrative blocks, he says

title: Health dept. calls for safety audits in public hospitals
content: In his first public statement after Kottayam MCH tragedy, Chief Minister reassures people that the government will take all necessary precautions to ensure that unfortunate and tragic events are not repeated

title: West Bengal Chief Secretary seeks Odisha counterpart’s help to stop harassment of Bengali-speaking migrant workers
content: Letter dated July 3 seeks ‘immediate intervention with utmost sensitivity’ and verification of the Indian citizenship of these workers

title: PM Modi conferred with Trinidad and Tobago’s highest civilian honour
content: This is PM Modi's first visit to the country as Prime Minister and the first Indian bilateral visit at the Prime Ministerial level to Trinidad and Tobago since 1999.

title: Plea to continue services of temporary faculty in public universities of Andhra Pradesh
content: Members of Akhil Bharatiya Rashtriya Shaikshik Mahasangh urge the APSCHE Chairman to expedite recruitment in State Universities

title: Yakshagana artistes and their battle between the contemporary and classic
content: Balancing modernity and tradition has always been a matter of debate when it comes to creative arts. Karnataka’s Yakshagana artistes weigh in...

title: 20.8% of proposed projects at Invest Kerala Global Summit are operational: P. Rajeeve
content: A total of 40,439 jobs are expected to be created through the projects that are operational now, says Industries Minister.

title: A.P. Governor exhorts students to be prepared for Quantum Valley
content: The Quantum Valley will place Andhra Pradesh at the forefront of quantum and deep technology advancement in Asia, says Governor S. Abdul Nazeer; It aims to foster innovation, high-end employment and environmental sustainability in Amaravati

title: Modi’s national security policy and foreign policy deceived India: Kharge
content: The AICC president also faulted the BJP-led Central government’s foreign policy and said this had resulted in India creating enemies all around, apart from China and Pakistan even friendly nations like Nepal are moving away from India, he said

title: Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Akademi to host National Percussion Festival in Thrissur from July 11
content: Event will bring together diverse percussion traditions from across the country. Curated by Keli Ramachandran, festival aims at spotlighting rhythm as a powerful cultural, artistic, and political expression

title: Kerala HC refuses to stay suspension of Kerala University Registrar
content: The suspension order is an extra-statutory order issued by a statutory authority as the V-C can initiate disciplinary action against officials only up to the rank of Deputy Registrar and is hence illegal and must be set aside, says counsel of Anil Kumar

title: Allahabad HC rejects plea to refer Mathura’s Shahi Idgah as ‘disputed structure’
content: Neither desirable nor expedient to issue such directions at this point, says court; plaintiff trying to introduce a case through the backdoor, says counsel representing the mosque

title: From herding cattle to earning doctorate degree in geology
content: Accolades pour in for Chintha Paramesh of Kondanagula village in Nagarkurnool district on his transformational journey

title: Housing Minister inspects land for house sites allocation to the poor in Eluru district
content: The Minister directs authorities to complete the land survey and levelling work promptly so that housing plots can be distributed to eligible beneficiaries without delay

title: Over 2,000 women demand MGNREGA jobs in Nagapattinam
content: The delay in work allocation, attributed to the absence of elected local body representatives;  only ₹6.23 lakh has been disbursed as wages this financial year as against ₹3 crore to ₹4 crore a year in the past

title: IUML leader Khader Mohideen chosen for Thagaisal Thamizhar Award
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin will present the award during the Independence Day celebrations in Chennai

title: Officials hopeful of TG-AP issues’ resolution at Cabinet meet on July 10
content: TG’s decision to call for officers’ committee meeting takes a backseat following AP’s moves on Banakacherla project

title: Curriculum committee approves chapter on Governor’s powers in school textbook
content: The chapter in Class 10 Social Science textbook also covers Emergency and the Supreme Court verdict that struck down electoral bonds. Second part of textbooks for Classes 2, 4, 6, 8 and 10, covering 95 titles, approved

title: Eluru District Collector instructs officials to draft action plans for constituency development
content: The goal is to eradicate poverty, generate employment for youth and ensure a 15% growth rate at the constituency-level, she says

title: Sixty years of Mathilukal marked with a wall of love
content: Students and faculty of Government Boys Higher Secondary School, Karamana commemorate the novel on the eve of Vaikom Mohammad Basheer’s death anniversary

title: Tantransco plans underground 110 kV feeder lines at Panjapur
content: The Tidel Park Ltd paid ₹28 crore to Tantransco for relocating the power lines; the power utility will first dismantle the 66 kV feeder lines, which are kept as reserve and later take up 110 kV Tiruchi-Thanjavur and 110 kV Tiruchi-Thuvakudi feeder lines

title: Amit Shah to lay foundation for India’s first national cooperative university in Gujarat
content: The varsity aims to address the growing need for skilled professionals in cooperative sector by offering specialised education, training and research programmes in cooperative management, finance, law and rural development

title: Forward looking reforms have transformed mining sector: Kishan Reddy
content: Mining sector fast emerging as champion of green transformation, the Minister told a conference on sustainable and responsible mining through best mine closure practices

title: Padayappa steals the show at a drawing competition in Munnar
content: At a drawing competition held as part of the Vana Mahotsavam celebrations at Government Anglo Tamil Primary School, all participants drew the picture of the wild elephant for the theme ‘Beauty of Munnar,’ say Forest department officials

title: New Responsible Tourism project to be introduced to aid landslides-hit people of Wayanad
content: Interested people from Meppadi to be trained in making handicrafts and souvenirs, which will be branded and marketed. Select members to be offered tour leader training. State government sanctions ₹13.58 lakh to impart training to the first batch

title: Issue 21 lakh new pattadar passbooks in first phase from August, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells Revenue officials
content: The Chief Minister also directs officials to issue succession certificates in respect of inherited lands and complete regularisation of unobjectionable government lands by the end of 2025

title: A new world in Big Apple baseball: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .

title: First woman fighter pilot in Navy: Sub Lt Aastha Poonia receives ‘Wings of Gold’
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'I learned from it': Jason Pierre-Paul opens up about fireworks incident that cost him his fingers 10 years ago
content: ex-new york Giants defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul owns a fourth of July accident that cost him 212 fingers . he has no choice but to be reminded of it when putting on a dress shirt and reaching for a button . "there's nothing to be embarrassed about," he tells ESPN last week .

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: Jerry Rice gives Bucs WR Mike Evans blessing to break 1,000-yard record
content: hamstring injury came on the final play of the season . the six-time pro bowler missed three games last season with a knee injury . he now has his shot at sole possession of the record, and he gives him his blessing .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .
